comments:
1. deploy->Dav
2. create a site which requires authentication
3. enter incorrect password
4. proceed to mapping page
5. expand site

You will eventually get a stack overflow.

The overflow is occuring in org.eclipse.webdav.http.client.HttpClient.invoke1
(), which calls itself recursively at line 777.

I notice its calling itself with 0 retries and 0 redirects.  What I don't see 
is where the # of retries is being checked, I assume this is supposed to bottom 
out at > 0?  Is the recursive call supposed to decrement the argument retries?

What I meant to say was, I don't see how the recursive call can bottom out 
unless it gets an IOException.
Adding Tim to CC for any insight.

Should the call be incrementing the number of retries?
If so, then it would fail later because # retries would be greater than the 
max.

With this patch you now get back "401: Authorization Required".  It would be 
better if possible if the response was "Authorization Failed".
